designScenario.name: Advanced Hydraulic Accumulator System
designScenario.description: A next-generation hydraulic accumulator designed to optimize energy storage, pressure regulation, and transient response in modern aircraft. It integrates adaptive pressure management, smart health monitoring, and lightweight composite materials to enhance reliability under variable flight conditions (e.g., high-altitude operations, extreme temperature cycles). The system supports fly-by-wire controls, thrust reversers, and emergency systems while meeting AS9100D aerospace quality standards.

details.description: The accumulator shall dynamically adjust gas pre-charge pressure (±5% accuracy) based on real-time hydraulic load demands using integrated pressure sensors and control algorithms.
The system shall discharge 95% of stored hydraulic energy within 0.25 seconds during emergency braking scenarios, as per EASA CS-25.1435 transient response mandates.
Dual independent relief valves (mechanical + electronic) shall activate at 110% of maximum operating pressure (5500 psi) to prevent catastrophic failure during fluid thermal expansion events.
Accumulator assembly mass shall not exceed 8.5 kg while maintaining a 4:1 safety factor under maximum cyclic loading (MIL-STD-810H vibration profile).

systemComponents.name: Composite Pressure Vessel
systemComponents.description: Carbon-fiber reinforced titanium liner structure rated for 6000 psi burst pressure with integrated strain gauges for structural health monitoring.

subComponents.name: Multi-Stage Separation Piston
subComponents.description: Dual-seal piston with PTFE coatings for minimal stiction, separating nitrogen charge from hydraulic fluid while accommodating thermal expansion

subComponents.name: Smart Charge Valve
subComponents.description: Electro-pneumatic valve maintaining gas pre-charge pressure through closed-loop control (0-5000 psi adjustable range)

systemComponents.name: Health Monitoring Module
systemComponents.description: Embedded IoT-capable sensor suite monitoring accumulator integrity (vibration, temperature, pressure differential) with prognostic maintenance alerts

subComponents.name: MEMS Pressure Transducer Array
subComponents.description: Redundant micro-electromechanical sensors providing ±0.1% accuracy pressure measurements at 100Hz sampling rate

subComponents.name: Vibration Analysis Processor
subComponents.description: FPGA-based unit detecting abnormal harmonic patterns indicative of piston wear or gas leakage

relationships.description: Accumulator health data is transmitted via ARINC 664 protocol to central maintenance systems for condition-based servicing
The pressure vessel is an integral subassembly within the aircraft's primary hydraulic power distribution network
EPU provides backup power to maintain gas pre-charge during electrical system failures per FAA AC 25.1309-1A

attributes.name: operatingTempRange
attributes.description: Full operational temperature envelope covering ground operations to supersonic flight conditions

attributes.name: cycleLife
attributes.description: Minimum fatigue life under maximum pressure differential (5000 psi Δ) with 99.9% reliability

attributes.name: fluidViscosityRange
attributes.description: Compatibility with MIL-PRF-83282 and Skydrol LD-4 hydraulic fluids across operational temperatures

attributes.name: gasPermeationRate
attributes.description: Maximum allowable nitrogen leakage through piston seals at 5000 psi operating pressure

comments.body: Advanced Hydraulic Accumulator System meeting AS9100D standards with composite construction and integrated health monitoring
